key_title: Key to the species of Crassula

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Crassulaceae

source.author: Toelken, H.R.; Jeanes, J.A.; Stajsic, V.
source.title: Crassulaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: Modified from: Toelken, H.R.; Jeanes, J.A.; Stajsic, V. (1996). Crassulaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Flowers single or in cymes in axils of leaf-like bracts along parts of or all branches; annuals or if perennials then flowers 4-merous (C. helmsii, C. sieberiana) or carpels each with 2 ovules (C. muscosa)
Flowers in terminal rounded inflorescences with reduced bracts; perennials with leaves usually longer than 12 mm (to 3.5 mm long in C. ericoides)
Perennial with scale-like leaves strictly opposite-decussate and overlapping
Annuals or if perennials then leaves loosely opposite, rarely decussate and not overlapping
Flowers in the axil of one leaf at each node; calyx half to two-thirds as long as the corolla (rarely longer in C. helmsii)
Flowers in the axil of both leaves at a node; calyx at least as long as corolla
Carpels each with 1 ovule
Carpels each with 2–14 ovules
Carpels gradually constricted into styles (c. half as long as body of carpels)
Carpels abruptly constricted into short styles (usually less than one-quarter as long as body of carpels)
Flowers pedicellate and loosely arranged along usually much-branched branches
Flowers sessile or almost so in spike-like inflorescences; plants little-branched mainly from the base
Carpels each with 4–24 ovules
Carpels each with 2 ovules
Seeds less than twice as long as broad, with widely spaced papillae along the vertical ridges; branches erect; calyx-lobes and bracts papillate toward the apex
Seeds greater than twice as long as broad, with dense papillae (c. touching one another) along vertical ridges; branches often decumbent; calyx-lobes usually smooth
Decumbent annuals, branched from base; fruiting calyx 0.5–1(–1.1) mm long, lobes spreading, somewhat fleshy, rarely with membranous margins
Erect annuals or decumbent perennials; fruiting calyx (1.1–)1.2–2.2 mm long, apex of lobes clasping each other or erect and lobes flattened to a more or less membranous margin
Uppermost leaves without a colourless point
Uppermost leaves with a colourless point
Flowers mainly 3-merous
Flowers 4- or 5-merous
[link through]
Follicles often tuberculate, not splitting longitudinally, detaching basally to release seed; styles at least two-thirds as long as bodies of carpels
Follicles smooth or papillose, splitting longitudinally from apex on adaxial side, but often detaching basally to release seed; styles up to one-quarter as long as bodies of carpels
Fruiting calyx-lobes incurved between half exposed recurved follicles
Fruiting calyx-lobes erect, enclosing erect follicles
Decumbent annuals, branched from base; fruiting calyx 0.5–1(–1.1) mm long, lobes spreading, somewhat fleshy, rarely with membranous margins
Erect annuals or decumbent perennials; fruiting calyx (1.1–)1.2–2.2 mm long, apex of lobes clasping each other or erect and lobes flattened to a more or less membranous margin
Uppermost leaves without a colourless point
Uppermost leaves with a colourless point
Leaves petiolate (rarely sessile in C. multicava and C. sarmentosa), loosely opposite; corolla star-shaped
Leaves sessile, stiffly 4-ranked or opposite; corolla tubular
Plants sprawling or prostrate, sparsely branched; leaves serrate
Plants decumbent to erect, often much-branched; leaves entire
Leaves often cordate; petiole 3–7(–18) mm long; petal lobes 3–5 mm long
Leaves subsessile, base obtuse or cuneate; petiole up to 3 mm long; petal lobes 4–11 mm long
Leaf lamina gradually tapering towards base; petiole often indistinct, less than 5 mm long; flowers 5-merious; corolla lobes more than 6 mm long
Leaf lamina usually abruptly constricted at base; petiole usually more than 5 mm long; flowers mostly 4-merious; corolla lobes less than 6 mm long
[link through]
Leaves scale-like, 3.2–3.5 mm long
Leaves linear-triangular, lanceolate or oblanceolate, 8–50 mm long
Plants mostly less than 30 cm high; stems less than 3 mm diam., internodes distinctly papillose; leaves with a whitish bloom
Shrubs or subshrubs mostly more than 30 cm high; basal branches 3–10 mm diam., internodes lacking papillae; leaves green or grey-green
Corolla lobes 4–5.5 mm long; leaves flattened, oblanceolate, 5–13 mm wide
Corolla lobes less than 3 mm long; leaves ± terete, linear-triangular, mostly 3–6 mm wide
[link through]
